#!/bin/bash

# Prompt user for MySQL configuration details
read -p "Enter MySQL root password: " MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
read -p "Enter MySQL user: " MYSQL_USER
read -p "Enter MySQL user password: " MYSQL_PASSWORD
read -p "Enter MySQL port (default is 3306): " MYSQL_PORT
MYSQL_PORT=${MYSQL_PORT:-3306}

# Download and install MySQL server
apt-get update
apt-get install -y mysql-server

# Start MySQL service
service mysql start

# Set MySQL root password
mysqladmin -u root password "$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD"

# Create a MySQL user and database
mysql -u root -p"$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD" -e "CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS $MYSQL_DATABASE;"
mysql -u root -p"$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD" -e "CREATE USER '$MYSQL_USER'@'%' IDENTIFIED WITH 'mysql_native_password' BY '$MYSQL_PASSWORD';"
mysql -u root -p"$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD" -e "GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON $MYSQL_DATABASE.* TO '$MYSQL_USER'@'%';"
mysql -u root -p"$MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD" -e "FLUSH PRIVILEGES;"

# Stop MySQL service
service mysql stop

# Update MySQL configuration to allow remote connections
echo -e "\n# Custom rules\nbind-address = 0.0.0.0" >> "/etc/mysql/mysql.conf.d/mysqld.cnf"
echo -e "\n# Custom rules\nport = $MYSQL_PORT" >> "/etc/mysql/mysql.conf.d/mysqld.cnf"

# Start MySQL service
service mysql start

echo -e "MySQL setup complete. Done"
